tit.cmt: ・「佐伯」を大文字にしました。・後述に「いたじ」の別表記が出てくるため、名前の初出で漢字も併記しました。

sen.j: 佐伯 伊多智（さえき の いたじ）は、奈良時代の貴族。
sen.e: Saeki no Itaji is a court noble in the Nara Period.
SAEKI no Itaji is a court noble in the Nara Period.
sen.cmt: ・「佐伯」を大文字表記にしました。
sen.e: SAEKI no Itaji is a court noble in the Nara Period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His main name is Saeki no Sukune.
His main name is SAEKI no Sukune.
sen.cmt: ・「佐伯」を大文字表記にしました。
sen.e: His main name is SAEKI no Sukune.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 名は伊多治や伊太智、伊多知、伊達とも書く。
sen.e: His name is also written in 伊多治, 伊太智, 伊多知, 伊達.
sen.cmt: 文意を明確にするため漢字表記しています。
sen.e: His name is also written in 伊多治, 伊太智, 伊多知 or 伊達 instead of 伊多智.
sen.cmt: ・「伊多智」とその他の名の漢字の違いが分かりやすいように、instead of以下に初出の名も併記しました。
sen.e: His name is also written in 伊多治, 伊太智, 伊多知 or 伊達 instead of 伊多智.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天平宝字8年（764年）9月11日 (旧暦)、衛門府前期であった佐伯伊多智は藤原仲麻呂の乱で孝謙天皇方として動いた。
sen.e: On October 14, 764, Saeki no Itaji, who was Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) in the early period, worked on the Emperor Koken's side in the Rebellion of Fujiwara no Nakamaro.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On October 14, 764 or September 11 on the old calendar, SAEKI no Itaji, who was Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) in the early period, worked on the Empress Koken's side in the Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro.
sen.cmt: ・孝謙天皇は女性なのでEmpressとしました。・原文が旧暦表記なので訳文にも念のため旧暦を追加しました。・「佐伯」と「藤原」を大文字にしました。
sen.e: On October 14, 764 or September 11 on the old calendar, SAEKI no Itaji, who was Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) in the early period, worked on the Empress Koken's side in the Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 藤原仲麻呂軍が近江国に逃亡しようとしたため山城国日下部子麻呂とともに田原道を先回りして近江に出て勢多橋を焼き落としその気勢を削いだ。
sen.e: When the army of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro attempted to escape to Omi Province, Itaji and 日下部子麻呂 of Yamashiro Province went ahead of the army of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro via Tawara-michi Road and came to Omi Province, burning out Setabashi Bridge and dampening their enthusiasm.
sen.cmt: 伊多智等→文意が不明なのですが→ Itaji等と訳出しています。一原文一訳文の例外対処。日下部子麻呂→定訳不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: When the army of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro attempted to escape to Omi Province, Itaji and KUSAKABE no Komaro of Yamashiro Province went ahead of the FUJIWARA's army via Tawara-michi Road and came to Omi Province, burning out Setabashi Bridge and dampening their enthusiasm.
sen.cmt: ・「日下部子麻呂」の読みは下記サイトを参照しました。http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%97%A5%E4%B8%8B%E9%83%A8%E5%AD%90%E9%BA%BB%E5%91%82・同じ文中にthe army of FUJIWARA no Nakamaroが2回も出てくるのは冗長なので、2回目を少し縮めました。
sen.e: When the army of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro attempted to escape to Omi Province, Itaji and KUSAKABE no Komaro of Yamashiro Province went ahead of the FUJIWARA's army via Tawara-michi Road and came to Omi Province, burning out Setabashi Bridge and dampening their enthusiasm.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 慌てた押勝軍が高島郡に向かうのを見て、伊多智等は馬を駆って先に越前国に入り押勝の息子である従五位下越前国藤原辛加知を斬殺した。
sen.e: After seeing the upset Oshikatsu's army heading for Takashima Country, Itaji 等 hurried horses and entered Echizen Province earlier than they did, killing the son of Oshikatsu, 藤原辛加知, Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) of Echizen Province.
sen.cmt: 伊多智等→文意が不明なのですが→ Itaji等と訳出しています。藤原辛加知→定訳不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: After seeing the upset Oshikatsu's army heading for Takashima County, Itaji and his allies hurried horses and entered Echizen Province earlier than the enemy did, killing the son of Oshikatsu, FUJIWARA no Shikachi, Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) of Echizen Province.
sen.cmt: ・「郡」はcountyとしました（countryとなっていました）。・「等」は、伊多智の味方のことを指すと解釈しand his alliesとしました。・三行目のtheyはより具体的にするためenemyとしました。・「藤原辛加知」は「ふじわらのしかち」とウィキペディアにありました。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%97%A4%E5%8E%9F%E8%BE%9B%E5%8A%A0%E7%9F%A5
sen.e: After seeing the upset Oshikatsu's army heading for Takashima County, Itaji and his allies hurried horses and entered Echizen Province earlier than the enemy did, killing the son of Oshikatsu, FUJIWARA no Shikachi, Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) of Echizen Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 翌9月12日 (旧暦)、伊多智等は塩焼王を騙して帝に擁立した。
sen.e: On October 14, 764, Itaji 等 cheated Shioyaki, and backed up him for an emperor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On October 14, 764 or September 12 on the old calendar, Itaji and his allies cheated Prince Shioyaki, and backed up him for an emperor.
sen.cmt: ・原文が旧暦表記なので訳文にも念のため旧暦を追加しました。・「等」は、伊多智の味方のことを指すと解釈しand his alliesとしました。・「王」の部分がなかったので追加しました。
sen.e: On October 14, 764 or September 12 on the old calendar, Itaji and his allies cheated Prince Shioyaki, and backed up him for an emperor.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 越前国に入ろうと愛発関に至った押勝軍と交戦、押勝軍の数名は伊多智等が放った矢に当たって死亡した。
sen.e: Itaji's force fought against Oshikatsu's army that reached Arachi no-seki checking station to enter Echizen Province and a few solders of Oshikatsu's army were died from arrows shot by Itaji 等.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Itaji's force fought against Oshikatsu's army that reached Arachi no-seki checking station to enter Echizen Province and a few solders of Oshikatsu's army were died from arrows shot by Itaji and his allies.
sen.cmt: ・「等」は、伊多智の味方のことを指すと解釈しand his alliesとしました。
sen.e: Itaji's force fought against Oshikatsu's army that reached Arachi no-seki checking station to enter Echizen Province and a few solders of Oshikatsu's army were died from arrows shot by Itaji and his allies.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: この戦功によって、伊多智は従五位下に叙せられ、9月18日 (旧暦)には逃亡した藤原仲麻呂が石村石楯によって斬殺された。
sen.e: For this distinguished war service, Itaji was appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), and on October 20, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro, who had escaped, was put to the sword by 石村石楯.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処石村石楯→定訳不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: For this distinguished war service, Itaji was appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), and on October 20 or September 18 on the old calendar, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro, who had escaped, was put to the sword by IWAMURA no Iwatate.
sen.cmt: ・「石村石楯」は「いわむらのいわたて」と読むようです。http://kotobank.jp/word/%E7%9F%B3%E6%9D%91%E7%9F%B3%E6%A5%AF・原文が旧暦表記なので訳文にも念のため旧暦を追加しました。
sen.e: For this distinguished war service, Itaji was appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), and on October 20 or September 18 on the old calendar, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro, who had escaped, was put to the sword by IWAMURA no Iwatate.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 高野天皇はその10月に淳仁天皇を廃し称徳天皇となり、逆徒追討の功で伊多智は従五位上に叙される。
sen.e: In October, Emperor Takano abandoned Emperor Junin and became Emperor Shotoku, and Itaji was appointed to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) for hunting down and killing rebels.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In October, Empress Takano abandoned Emperor Junin and became Empress Shotoku, and Itaji was appointed to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) for hunting down and killing rebels.
sen.cmt: ・高野天皇、孝謙天皇は女性なのでEmpressとしました。
sen.e: In October, Empress Takano abandoned Emperor Junin and became Empress Shotoku, and Itaji was appointed to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) for hunting down and killing rebels.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 翌年の天平神護元年（765年）1月7日 (旧暦)に伊多智は勲二等の叙勲を授かる。
sen.e: In the following year, on February 5, 765, Itaji was granted the Order of Second Class.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the following year, on February 5, 765 or January 7 on the old calendar, Itaji was granted the Order of Second Class.
sen.cmt: ・原文が旧暦表記なので訳文にも念のため旧暦を追加しました。
sen.e: In the following year, on February 5, 765 or January 7 on the old calendar, Itaji was granted the Order of Second Class.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: さらに天平神護2年（766年）2月21日 (旧暦)には功田20町を与えられ代々の地権も授かった。
sen.e: On April 8, 766, Kuden (rice fields given to those who did meritorious deeds for the state) of 20 towns and the right of land for generations were given to him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Moreover, on April 8, 766 or February 21 on the old calendar, 20 towns of Kuden (rice fields given to those who did meritorious deeds for the state) and the right of land for generations were given to him.
sen.cmt: ・原文が旧暦表記なので訳文にも念のため旧暦を追加しました。・「20町」の位置を変更しました。
sen.e: Moreover, on April 8, 766 or February 21 on the old calendar, 20 towns of Kuden (rice fields given to those who did meritorious deeds for the state) and the right of land for generations were given to him.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 神護景雲2年（768年）2月18日 (旧暦)、従四位下となった伊多智は近衛兵令制の五衛府に任じられ、さらに同年10月15日 (旧暦)には従四位上に叙せられる。
sen.e: On March 15, 768, Itaji, Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade), was appointed to Goefu (five guards) of Konoeheiryosei, Imperial Guard System, and on December 2, he was appointed to Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade).

On March 15, 768 or February 18 on the old calendar, Itaji, who became Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade), was appointed to Goefu (five guards) of Konoeheiryosei, Imperial Guard System, and on December 2 or October 15 (old calendar), he was appointed to Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: ・原文が旧暦表記なので訳文にも念のため旧暦を追加しました。
sen.e: On March 15, 768 or February 18 on the old calendar, Itaji, who became Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade), was appointed to Goefu (five guards) of Konoeheiryosei, Imperial Guard System, and on December 2 or October 15 (old calendar), he was appointed to Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 宝亀2年（771年）3月1日 (旧暦)、近衛兵令外官であった伊多智は下野守の兼務を命ぜられ下野国に下向する。
sen.e: On March 25, 771, Itaji, who was Konoeheiryosei, Ryoge no kan of Imperial Guard System, was additionally assigned to Shimotsuke no kami (the governor of Shimotsuke Province), leaving the capital for Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On March 25, 771 or March 1 on the old calendar, Itaji, who was Konoehei Ryoge no kan (a post outside the original Ritsuryo code created by Imperial edicts), was additionally assigned to Shimotsuke no kami (the governor of Shimotsuke Province), leaving the capital for Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: ・原文が旧暦表記なので訳文にも念のため旧暦を追加しました。・「令外官」は用語集を参考にして（）内に英訳を追加しました。・「近衛兵」のスペルを修正しました。
sen.e: On March 25, 771 or March 1 on the old calendar, Itaji, who was Konoehei Ryoge no kan (a post outside the original Ritsuryo code created by Imperial edicts), was additionally assigned to Shimotsuke no kami (the governor of Shimotsuke Province), leaving the capital for Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: Further information about him was not recorded in kiki (the Kojiki and Nihonshoki) after that.
